Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The commentary of Japheth ben Ali ha-Levi on the book of Job, chapters 1-22.

collation.p: 20 quires (nos. 1-18, 20-21), originally of 10 leaves each. Apart from the quires 3, 13, 18, all the quires are imperfect. The quires are signed with Hebrew letters and Arabic numerals on the upper margin of the first page.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Square and semi-cursive script of the 15th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Yefet. Comm. on Job. Vol. I. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2510.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882, folio [128v].
